channel.title: [PI] Yell Muted

item.title: [PI] Yell Muted
item.dc:creator: @Keatrm Keatrm
item.description:
@Keatrm wrote:

Okay :]

if (playerCommand.startsWith("mute") && c.playerRights >= 1) { try { String playerToBan = playerCommand.substring(5); Connection.addNameToMuteList(playerToBan); for(int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) { if(Server.playerHandler.players[i] != null) { if(Server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(playerToBan)) { Client c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[i]; c2.sendMessage("You have been muted by: " + c.playerName); break; } } } } catch(Exception e) { c.sendMessage("Player Must Be Offline."); } }

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Yell Muted
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

[quote=“Keatrm, post:10, topic:385979”]The mute does work, no one can see what they muted user types, it just doesn’t say ‘You have been muted, and cannot talk.’

I’m using Exion [PI] I thought this was how all servers were?[/quote]
To make it so other users don’t see the inputted text, you need to have a variable which checks if the user is muted or not. Obviously your mute command uses that boolean, otherwise it wouldn’t even work. Show me your mute command.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Yell Muted
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

[quote=“Keatrm, post:8, topic:385979”]Yes I do, when I do ::mute (user) it says to them: ‘You have been muted by (username).’
But after that they never get another message saying there muted.

Example:
I’m spamming
I get muted
‘you have been muted by (user)’
If I continue to spam there is no message that says ‘You are muted and cannot speak.’ , even though other users can’t see the chat.

It’s kinda hard to explain :b[/quote]
Then it should have something which actually mutes the player

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Yell Muted

Example:

I get muted

item.title: [PI] Yell Muted
item.dc:creator: @laurent_248 laurent 248
item.description:
@laurent_248 wrote:

Search the right command then copy it to create a noYell command,
if(playerRights == 0 && c.noYell == 1) {
p.sm(“You have been muted and cannot use the yell system”); (change it for a 317, i dont know how)
}

If the mute command is acting like a right command, you could use it. But for my way, you need to mute the yell AND the player.

If there something like c.playerMuted somewhere in client.java, you could use it.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Yell Muted
item.dc:creator: @Keatrm Keatrm
item.description:
@Keatrm wrote:

Here is my yell command:

if (playerCommand.startsWith("/") && playerCommand.length() > 1) { if (c.clanId >= 0) { System.out.println(playerCommand); playerCommand = playerCommand.substring(1); Server.clanChat.playerMessageToClan(c.playerId, playerCommand, c.clanId); } else { String rank = ""; String Message = playerCommand.substring(1); if (c.playerRights >= 0) { rank = "[Player]["+ c.playerName +"]:"; if (c.playerRights >= 1) { rank = "@blu@[Mod]@bla@["+ c.playerName +"]:"; } if (c.playerRights >= 2) { rank = "@yel@[Admin]@bla@["+ c.playerName +"]:"; } if (c.playerRights >= 3) { rank = "@red@[Owner]@bla@["+ Misc.ucFirst(c.playerName) +"]: "; } if (c.playerRights >= 4) { rank = "[Player]["+ c.playerName +"]:"; } for (int j = 0; j < Server.playerHandler.players.length; j++) { if (Server.playerHandler.players[j] != null) { Client c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[j]; c2.sendMessage(rank+Message); } } } } return; }

and another one:

[code] if (playerCommand.startsWith(“yell”)) {
String rank = “”;
String Message = playerCommand.substring(4).toLowerCase();
if (c.playerRights >= 0) {
rank = “[Player][”+ c.playerName +"]:";
if (c.playerRights >= 1) {
rank = “@blu@[Mod]@bla@[”+ c.playerName +"]:";
}
if (c.playerRights >= 2) {
rank = “@yel@[Admin]@bla@[”+ c.playerName +"]:";
}
if (c.playerRights >= 3) {
rank = “@red@[Owner]@bla@[”+ c.playerName +"] : “;
}
if (c.playerRights >= 4) {
rank = “[Player][”+ c.playerName +”]:";
}
for (int j = 0; j < Server.playerHandler.players.length; j++) {
if (Server.playerHandler.players[j] != null) {
Client c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[j];
c2.sendMessage(rank+Message);
}
}
}

	}[/code]

How can I make it say ‘You have been muted and cannot use the yell system.’ when they try to yell if they are muted?

[PI] - EXION

Read full topic
